TMF; TMOF Ecuador; Panama; Colombia ✔ Partial* Partial 29 (Comita et al., 2007) TMF Panama ✔ ✔ Partial* Partial 30 (Queenborough et al., 2007) TRF Ecuador ✔ ✔(CII) Partial* Partial 31 (Svenning et al., 2008) TMRF Ecuador ✔ Yes* Partial 32 (Balvanera et al., 2011) TDF Mexico ✔ ✔ Partial* Partial 33 (Itoh et al., 2010) TRF Malaysia ✔ Partial* Not assessed 34 (Chuyong et al., 2011) TRF Cameroon ✔ Partial* Partial 35 (Jones et al., 2011) TMOF Bolivia ✔ ✔ ✔(HP) ✔ FS Partial Partial 36 (Metz, 2012) TRF Ecuador ✔ Partial* Partial 37 (Inman-Narahari et al., 2013) TMOF Studies conducted at the landscape or greater scales have been excluded, with a few exceptions where results may be applicable to the local scale based on the sampling design used. Studies where habitats have been defined based on species distributions (e.g. Kanagaraj et al., 2011; Keppel et al., 2011) or where species-habitat associations have not been tested (Baldeck et al., 2012; Brown et al., 2013) are also excluded. "Partial" in the "habitat associations" column indicates that some, but not all species were associated with habitats. "Partial" in the "niche differentiation" column indicates that some species were associated with distinct habitats while others were associated with the same habitats.

FIGREF0.text: tested; Forest types: TRF = Tropical rainforest, TMF = Tropical moist forest, TMOF = Tropical montane forest, TDF = Tropical dry forest; Habitat variables: CC = Canopy closure, CH = Canopy height, CII = Crown illumination index, CPI = Crown position index, EM = establishment microsites, FC = Fungal counts, FS = Forest structure, HP = hemispherical photographs, ST = Substrate type; Locations: CAR = Central African Republic.
